snippet: A federal bankruptcy judge ruled that the automaker that emerged from bankruptcy in 2009 is not liable for accidents tied to the defect that occurred before that time.
abstract: Federal bankruptcy Judge Robert E Gerber rules that shield from liability in 2009 General Motors bankruptcy agreement should remain in effect, blocking majority of lawsuits against company over defective ignition switch.

byline.original: By HILARY STOUT and DANIELLE IVORY

lead_paragraph: A federal bankruptcy judge ruled that the automaker that emerged from bankruptcy in 2009 is not liable for accidents tied to the defect that occurred before that time.

headline.main: Ruling Shields G.M. From Ignition Suits
headline.print_headline: Bankruptcy Judge’s Ruling Shields G.M. From Ignition Lawsuits
